caption: The Zoo is very beautiful and organised. The map(posted below) really helps along the complete route. It takes around 3-4 hours maximum to traverse along all the animals including having your lunch. There are two cafeterias to have lunch in. And it is divided into several Regions.

The zoo is very beautiful and well-maintained. The rare animals, especially the marine ones, are a delight to see. The zoo is well-indicated, and the animals seem happy and well-cared for. However, I noticed that the baboon monkeys seemed to be in need of more vegetation in their enclosure. I hope the zoo administration will consider addressing this issue. The Amazon corner of the zoo is particularly impressive and well-designed.

Best zoo we‚Äôve ever been. Maybe it was in August and all the Parisians are out for holidays. The zoo was very quiet to visit on a Sunday. Out little one really enjoyed the flat and easy walk in the park. The animals were glassed for better observation for the little ones. Appreciate the design. The feeding sessions of the sea lion was interactive as well. Overall, we had great time! If you have young child, I would suggest you bring them in a sling rather than push a pram.  It will allow more flexibility!

Zoo was so fun! We had a nice lunch and all the animals were so great. Watching the feeding of the jaguars was the highlight of the day, as well as the hedgehog sunbathing under the heat lamp which was super adorable.

If you‚Äôre going to see tigers because of the ‚ÄúMadeleine‚Äù cartoon, they only have lions. I‚Äôm just kidding but that is true.  It still a awesome zoo they had a lot of species I had never seen before. Worth the visit.
Fun experience. The zoo isn't too big and it was very calm. We went in the afternoon on a thursday in mid july. It can get quite warm in the park but we had a great time.

This zoo is wonderful. Excellent layout and the enclosures are large with several animals living together. Interesting animals and birds. The tropical house was really great. Our toddler loved running around here for a few hours. Great place to safely spend a few hours with kids and have access to lots of toilets/baby change and food/water outlets. We didn‚Äôt really encounter any staff aside from the ticket seller who was nice enough.
Very good zoo. Animals are in a sort of free range mixed by region confinement. It was interesting to see American type animals in pins on display.
Amazing place in Paris. Lotof animals and lot of environmental structures. Really nice. Nice place to bring Kids. For adults 22‚Ç¨ For babies less than 3 years are free
Almost didnt visit, and that wouldve been a shame! Didnt expect to see this nice zoo in a city. Strongly suggest visiting, very nice place for a good price. Animals seemed healthy and happy too

One of the most beautiful zoos I have seen. A huge plus is the single path that makes it hard to get lost. The park looks very well-maintained. We spent 4-5 hours there. I would gladly go there again.

I was expecting more from Paris but still loved the experience and kids loved it as well so will recommend...we got to see all the usual species..and a wolf that doesn't stop running in circle.. we stood there 10 minutes..just to see..and during those minutes he kept on running even after a pipi break..

Absolutely do not recommend you going here if you like animals‚Ä¶ It‚Äôs bizarre the little space and conditions these animals are placed in. They shouldn‚Äôt be in any zoo, in the first place. Let‚Äôs please stop supporting zoos of any sort. It‚Äôs time we evolve! Let the species be where they belong. These places are all about making money and zero about animal care / protection (although they claim it to be‚Ä¶)!!!

It's a great zoo in Paris city with great on-street car parking available (make sure to go there early). There are no English displays and it was a significant drawback. We could see the zoo in 3 hours, and you can rent a buggy there for your child.

Great helpful staff, with beautiful terrariums for the animals with diverse vegetation. Was really impressed with the penguin enclosure and the Manatee mangrove style aquarium. 4 star as no toilet had a toilet seat including the disabled toilet.
It‚Äôs fun for kids, the time we visited in it wasn‚Äôt crowded at all. You might not see all the animals for example the lion was so lazy to move his b*t off üò¨. But overall we enjoyed it

Vincennes Zoo is ta great place when you want to take a break from Paris and have a walk seeing animals from all over the globe. The park is fairly small, the visit takes under 3 hours to complete. The design of the park is great, you just follow the main path and get to see all the animals. The pens are clean and quite big. Food is easy to access while visiting, with a great view on the giraffe enclosure, decent prices and honestly better quality than expected.  Definitely recommend to go check out this place and enjoy a nice Sunday walk in there.

Was there at the end of November. Not busy, so it was great to take our time and enjoy the place.  I like to visit zoo's but can't help feel sorry for the animals. The Anteater was walking back and forth. Perhaps he needs a bigger cage.

It was a nice experience for the kids, my one comment is the lions, we waited for feeding time and were shocked to see the lions very weak and thin, would have expected that they take better care of such beautiful creatures.
It‚Äôs awesome ü§© clean  lots of animals. The price and the zoo workers are very polite to everyone and also big place for picnic too‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è ‚Ä¶

Very good zoo. There are lots of animals. The place is not crowded, you have the chance to see animals from several angles and this helps to decrease the time of the waiting. There are places to take some rest, this makes the visit easy with the children. There are also some restaurants and vending machines everywhere.

I had the pleasure of visiting the Paris Zoo during a week long stay here in the city.  I visit a local zoo back home weekly, so I was eager to check this place out.  I must say, I was overall impressed. What I loved about the enclosures was how full of grass and plant life there was. Much more natural settings, as opposed to concrete.  What a variety of species too. I really loved the puma, baboons, and the wolves. While I wish some of the enclosures were bigger for the animal's sake, maybe down the road that can be done.  Another reviewer posted about how angry they were that some of the animals didn't come out during their visit. Newsflash...They don't have to! They have that right. Just be grateful there's a place like the Paris Zoo where they can live peacefully and be taken care of.  Thank you for letting me spend an afternoon at your zoo.

Beautiful facilities with a nice leisurely walkway that was easy to navigate with numerous maps posted around. The animals appeared well cared for, and the settings seemed natural overall. The mountain feature was a great landmark of the parc.

Really nice zoo inside Par√≠s.  It's crazy how they manage to have all that animals inside such a big city. It took me 3 hours to look all the animals. It's possible to bring your own food and do a picnic
Very nice, clean, green, a lot of animals, nice places to rest and eat, kids friendly.

An interesting small zoo in the heart of Paris. The site is quite nice, it has a variety of animals from different regions, and the place is well maintained and the animals seem to be calm and less stressed, or they are used to people ü§∑. The front desk experience wasn't the best nor friendliest, but I got by with my little french.

We visited this park in order to take a walk.  In the end, we spent 4 hours sightseeing.  The park is huge.  Each animal has its own name and description, and plenty of room for natural movement.  The part with snakes like the amazon is completely amazing.The animals look happy and their food is everywhere.We were most impressed with the Jaguar.  A beautiful cat.  Any recommendation from us!The visit is worth every cent‚ù§Ô∏è
A very beautiful place, perfect for going out to relax in contact with nature.

Parc Zoologique in Paris offers an enchanting wildlife experience in the heart of the city. With well-designed enclosures, informative exhibits, and a commitment to conservation, it's a must-visit for families and nature lovers alike.

Amazing zoo.  Super clean with beautiful vegetation throughout the park.  It feels very natural and does not have a bunch of in your face shops trying to sell things like in the US.  I have been to the San Diego Zoo, ,Miami Zoo and a few others and this one is my favorite.  Very relaxing.  One of the many cool features is the glass window into the veterinarian, where you can watch them caring for the animals.

Bought tickets online and came there with a family of 2 adults and 2 kids. A great feature is that they have strollers to rent which is great to avoid kids being grumpy after long walking hours. It is fantastic that they have predator cages built in a way that you get really close to the Puma, Panther, Lion, Lynx etc. Loved the scenery and that the animals have a lot of space to roam around. Plenty of restaurants and refreshment inside as well as nicely located toilets. There is a very well equipped shop at the entrance/exit.
smaller cute zoo, soent there like a 3 hours :)

What differentiates this zoo with others is it's natural ambience. Plenti of animals, reptiles, amphibians and birds to watch. Natural forest like ambience has been created that is nice to watch as well as good for the animals. There is a show of the feeding of the sea-lions, that should not be missed. Nice to visit on a sunny day with the kids.

This Park is beautiful and has such beautiful animals. You can easily spend your entire Saturday here. We saw a black puma, giraffes, rhinos, beautiful birds and some creepy reptiles. It was definitely worth the effort!

Amazing place. Good choice to spend a lot of time with family. You can take lunch with you & eat on playing area & kids can run around. A lot of different animals. Tropical zone will transfer you to some jungle. Very recommended to visit.

It is nice place to visit in Paris specially with kids. This park is open all days in week. In summer (May to August) opening hours 9:30 am to 8:30 pm and during winter it is open from 9:30 am till 6:30 pm. Many animals are there to visit. They have multiple show with animals throughout the day which are very entertaining. Show schedule is available at the entrance only.

Enjoyed my visit to the zoo. Tickets are freely available at the counter. Try to visit the zoo on a less sunny day, because you won't be able to see the animals well through the glass when the sun is reflecting off it. Much better to have a cloudy background to have more visibility.  The zoo was clean and there were many food places and toilets. I highly recommend it to anyone
Nice Zoo in the middle of the city. Not so big, you finish it in 2 hours. Good family activity. It gets hot.
